content:
The "peter-peter-peter" call is a great clue! That's a very distinctive sound, and it's a common call of the Tufted Titmouse! They're known for their repetitive, whistled calls, which often sound like "peter-peter-peter" or "see-see-see". So, it's definitely possible that the bird you saw was a Tufted Titmouse.

Now, about those other birds you've seen at the nature reserve... I'd be happy to help you try to identify them! Please share any details you can remember about each bird, such as:

* Size and shape
* Plumage colors and patterns
* Beak shape and size
* Any distinctive markings or features
* Behavior (e.g., foraging, flying, perching)
* Habitat (e.g., trees, bushes, water's edge)

The more information you can provide, the better I'll be able to help you identify the birds.

Also, since you're visiting the nature reserve regularly, you might want to consider keeping a "life list" or a journal to record your bird sightings. This can be a fun way to track your progress and keep a record of your observations.

Go ahead and share your observations about the other birds you've seen, and I'll do my best to help you identify them!
